node.name: entries
node.description: Enclosing container for a list of forwarding database entries within the network instanceNone

node.name: entry
node.description: A forwarding database entry within the network instanceNone

node.name: index
node.description: A pointer to the index of the FIB entry within the network instanceNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to the forwarding entryNone

node.name: index
node.description: A unique index referring to the FIB entryNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to the forwarding entryNone

node.name: index
node.description: A unique index referring to the FIB entryNone

node.name: packets-forwarded
node.description: The number of packets which have matched - and hence been forwarded - based on the FIB entryNone

node.name: octets-forwarded
node.description: The number of octets which have matched and been forwarded by the FIB entryNone

node.name: match
node.description: Match criteria for the FIB entryNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration of match criteria for the FIB entryNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters for match criteria of the FIB entryNone

node.name: ip-prefix
node.description: The IP prefix that the forwarding entry matches. Used for Layer 3 forwarding entries.None

node.name: mac-address
node.description: The MAC address that the forwarding entry matches. Used for Layer 2 forwarding entries, e.g., within a VSI instance.None

node.name: mpls-label
node.description: The MPLS label that the forwarding entry matches. Used for MPLS forwarding entries, whereby the local device acts as an LSRNone

node.name: next-hops
node.description: Enclosing container for the list of next-hops associated with the forwarding entryNone

node.name: next-hop
node.description: A next-hop associated with the forwarding instance. The entries within the next-hop list should only reflect next-hops that are actively used by the local system. That is to say inactive, backup or FRR next-hops should not be included within this list.None

node.name: index
node.description: A unique index identifying the next-hop entry for the FIB entryNone

node.name: config
node.description: Configuration parameters relating to the FIB next-hop entryNone

node.name: index
node.description: A unique entry for the next-hopNone

node.name: state
node.description: Operational state parameters relating to the FIB next-hop entryNone

node.name: index
node.description: A unique entry for the next-hopNone

node.name: weight
node.description: The weight of the next-hop. Traffic is balanced according to the ratio described by the relative weights of the next hops that exist for the FIB entry. Note that all next-hops that are specified are assumed to be active next-hops and therefore eligible (and selected) for packet forwarding.None

node.name: ip-address
node.description: The IP address of the next-hop systemNone

node.name: mac-address
node.description: The MAC address of the next-hop if resolved by the local network instanceNone

node.name: mpls-label-stack
node.description:
The MPLS label stack imposed when forwarding packets to the next-hop - the stack is encoded as a leaf list whereby the order of the entries is such that the first entry in the list is the label at the bottom of the stack.
To this end, a packet which is to forwarded to a device using a service label of 42, and a transport label of 8072 will be represented with a label stack list of [42, 8072]None

node.name: network-instance
node.description: The table within which the next-hop should be resolved. When this leaf is unspecified, the next-hop is resolved within the local instance.None
